hints.content:
Numbers are equivalent when they represent the same place on the number line.

Let's compare each point to $\blueD{\dfrac54}$ and find the equivalent fraction.

options.alt: Two sets of rectangles sit on top of each other. The top set is made up of 8 rectangles labeled one-fourth. Each rectangle represents one-fourth of a whole. The last four rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first five rectangles from the left are shaded. The bottom set of rectangles is made up of 6 rectangles labeled one-third. Each rectangle represents one-third of a whole. The last three rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first five rectangles from the left are shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks above the number line from zero-fourths to eight-fourths and tick marks below the number line  from zero-thirds to six-thirds. A blue point appears at five-fourths. A pink point appears at five-thirds. The pink point is to the right of the blue point. !

Two sets of rectangles sit on top of each other. The top set is made up of 8 rectangles labeled one-fourth. Each rectangle represents one-fourth of a whole. The last four rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first five rectangles from the left are shaded. The bottom set of rectangles is made up of 8 rectangles labeled one-fourth. Each rectangle represents one-fourth of a whole. The last four rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first six rectangles from the left are shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks above the number line from zero-fourths to eight-fourths and tick marks below the number line  from zero-fourths to eight-fourths. A blue point appears at five-fourths. A green point appears at six-fourths. The green point is to the right of the blue point. !

Two sets of rectangles sit on top of each other. The top set is made up of 8 rectangles labeled one-fourth. Each rectangle represents one-fourth of a whole. The last four rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first five rectangles from the left are shaded. The bottom set of rectangles is made up of 16 rectangles labeled one-eighth. Each rectangle represents one-eighth of a whole. The last eighth rectangles from the left are shifted downward. The first ten rectangles from the left are shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks above the number line from zero-fourths to eight-fourths and tick marks below the number line  from zero-eighths to sixteen-eighths. A blue and purple point appears at five-fourths, which is the same as ten-eighths. !

hints.content: $\purpleD{N}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac54}$.

The following number line is equivalent to $\dfrac54$.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, seven unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at 1, an unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark at point N, five unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 2. !

question.content:
**Which number line shows a number equivalent to $\dfrac{5}{4}$? **

[[☃ radio 2]]
